On Tue, Jul 22, 2008 at 01:27:27PM -0700, Erik Hetzner wrote:
> At Tue, 22 Jul 2008 13:18:50 -0700,
> Colin Meyer <cmeyer@...> wrote:
> > 
> > Hi,
> > 
> > I'm running heritrix from the command line, like tgeorgio.
> > 
> > I can start a crawl and watch the progress-statistics.log file to
> > see its progress.
> > 
> > What is the expected behavior when the crawl is done? I'm seeing the
> > heritrix keep running, updating the progress-statistics.log with
> > lines that indicate no activity. I would have hoped that the process
> > would end when the crawl is done.
> > 
> > What is the proper way to end the heritrix process with no web ui?
> > Is it ok to just kill the process?
> > 
> > I'd like to control crawls with some shell scripts.
> > 
> > Thanks,
> > -Colin.
> > 
> > p.s. I'm still on 1.12.1, to take advantage of the dedupe-plugin.
> 
> Hi Colin.
> 
> When the job is finished the 3rd line of the state.job file should be
> start with ???Finished???. It sounds like the job is probably still
> running if the progress-statistics.log is updated. There is a shutdown
> command you can use via JMX but a SIGTERM shuts it down pretty cleanly.

Thanks for the info, Erik.

So, if I don't have a state.job file, the crawl job is still running?

All of my completed jobs have that file, but the recently started one
does not.

Since my first message, the job has completed. I still don't see a 
state.job file, but the progress-statistics.log has a line that says

  20080722202100 CRAWL ENDED - Finished

So I can watch for that.

Thanks,
-Colin.
